alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 1:42AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN WEST FELICIANA, WEST BATON ROUGE, SOUTHEASTERN POINTE COUPEE, SOUTHWESTERN EAST FELICIANA, NORTHWESTERN IBERVILLE AND NORTHWESTERN EAST BATON ROUGE PARISHES THROUGH 215 AM CST... At 142 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ramah, or 16 miles northeast of Catahoula, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Port Allen, New Roads, St. Francisville, Brusly, Livonia, Maringouin, Fordoche, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Merrydale, Erwinville, Ramah, Brownfields, and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 128 and 155. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana
